type.context: PROVISIONAL COLLECTION OF TAXES ACT under Short title. 1. This Act may be cited as the Provisional Collection of Taxes Act.
type.description: This Act may be cited as the Provisional Collection of Taxes Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Alteration of or exemption from duty payable under existing law when bill approved by the Minister.
type.context: PROVISIONAL COLLECTION OF TAXES ACT under Alteration of or exemption from duty payable under existing law when bill approved by the Minister. 2.  When the Minister has, during any session of the National Assembly, approved of the introduction into the National Assembly of a bill whereby, if it be passed into law, an import, export or excise duty is imposed on any article or articles previously exempt from that duty, or whereby the  import, export or excise duty or duties previously payable on any article or articles is altered, the Minister may order that the Comptroller of Customs or the district commissioner, as the case may be, shall demand, levy, and collect on that article or those articles, the respective duty or duties set forth in the bill as the duty or duties to be levied thereon respectively, instead of the duties payable thereon, respectively under the existing law:  LAWS OF GUYANA 4 Cap. 79:03                                                                            Provisional Collection of Taxes                                     L.R.O. 1/2012          Commence- ment and duration of order.                  Refund of duties.      Provided that, where the alteration of the duty contained in the bill is a reduction of the duty under the existing law the duty under the existing law shall be levied and collected.

type.name: section
type.title: Commencement and duration of order.
type.context: PROVISIONAL COLLECTION OF TAXES ACT under Commencement and duration of order. 3. (1)  Every order aforesaid shall come into force on the day whereon a motion for the first reading of the bill is made in the National Assembly and, for the period limited by this section, shall have statutory effect as if contained in an Act.  (2) The order shall cease to have statutory effect  (a)  on the rejection by the National Assembly of the bill in respect of which the order was issued; or  (b)  on the withdrawal of the bill; or  (c)  when the bill enacted comes into operation as an Act.
